description: Today in Nature Magazine: Our MatterGen model represents a paradigm shift in materials design, applying generative AI to create new compounds with specific properties with unprecedented precision. Read more here: https://lnkd.in/gURKjUce
name: Satya Nadella

description:
Announcing Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat. Making AI more accessible to every employee in every business.

Learn more here: aka.ms/CopilotChat
name: Satya Nadella

description: The foundation models we'll build with Mayo Clinic promise to help transform how radiologists do their work, using multimodal AI to help them analyze X-rays faster and more accurately.
name: Satya Nadella

description:
There is no more waitlist for GitHub Copilot Workspace—the most advanced agentic editor. Start building with agents today. 

Sign up here: https://lnkd.in/g9WCJZDd
name: Satya Nadella

description:
Our hearts go out to everyone affected by the devastating fires in California.
In collaboration with Planet Labs, we leveraged our damage assessment AI models on high-resolution SkySat satellite imagery provided by Planet. This collaboration enabled us to map affected areas and generate critical insights to aid recovery efforts. These maps have been shared with organizations on the ground to assist in damage assessments and response planning.

Key Findings from Los Angeles Imagery Analysis:

17,835 buildings analyzed:

6,251 are obscured by clouds, shadow, or smoke.
9,229 are likely unaffected (as of 1/8, 2:21 PM PT).
2,355 are likely affected by the fires.

We acknowledge that these fires are ongoing, and the presence of smoke and other obstructions may result in additional impacted buildings that are not yet detectable.

This analysis represents a portion of the Palisades fire; other fires in the region are not included in this assessment. While these insights offer a valuable initial overview, they remain preliminary and require on-the-ground verification for a comprehensive understanding of the damage.

The AI for Good Lab remains steadfast in its commitment to supporting affected communities during this challenging time. 

If your organization would benefit from access to the underlying data in this report, please reach out to me. We are committed to sharing this information to support ongoing recovery efforts.

Explore the data through this interactive visualizer:

👉 https://lnkd.in/g6swWfh6
name: Satya Nadella

description: Exciting to see the new RTX 50-series GPUs and Windows Subsystem for Linux powering models from Nvidia NIM and Azure AI Foundry on Windows 11 PCs. A game-changer for running AI on the edge.
name: Satya Nadella

description: It was great to meet the team at ADT Baramati today, who are using our AI tools to help farmers grow healthier, more sustainable harvests.
name: Satya Nadella

description: Just in time for test-time scaling, we have our first NVlink 72 clusters live in Azure. Here’s to the next generation of AI built on these systems!
name: Satya Nadella

description: AI is already transforming the lives of people across India by creating new opportunities and jobs, as stories like Jui's, Raghavendra's, and Venkatesh's show. That's why we’re committed to helping to equip 10 million Indians with essential AI skills by 2030.
name: Satya Nadella

description: Thrilled to announce our new investments in AI infrastructure and skilling in India to help accelerate the country’s AI transformation. https://lnkd.in/g5TYP7xJ
name: Satya Nadella

description: Thank you, PM Narendra Modi ji for your leadership. Excited to build on our commitment to making India AI-first and work together on our continued expansion in the country to ensure every Indian benefits from this AI platform shift.
name: Satya Nadella

description:
Every general-purpose technology creates new opportunity across the economy. But it requires companies and countries to invest in new infrastructure and equip people with the right skills. And that’s what we are doing at Microsoft in this AI era, starting in the US.

As Brad Smith outlines, we want to ensure every American benefits from this AI platform shift, whether it is a scientist discovering a new drug or a high school grad launching a career in cyber security, a farmer embracing precision agriculture or a small business owner becoming more competitive.
name: Satya Nadella

description:
GitHub Copilot Free for VS Code has arrived.

Sign up today: https://lnkd.in/gdAcfCnm
name: Satya Nadella

description:
The pace of AI innovation this past year has been truly remarkable. But looking back, what stands out most is the incredible speed at which this technology has diffused, turning innovation into real impact—one person, one organization, one community at a time. 

And throughout 2024, I had the privilege of witnessing countless examples of this around the world.
name: Satya Nadella

description: A true legend, Ustad Zakir Hussain, who brought immense joy through his rhythmic brilliance. Your music transcends boundaries and will live on forever. #Legend #Alvida #MusicLivesOn
name: Satya Nadella

description:
I just loved this example our healthcare team shared at a recent radiology conference about the power of Microsoft 365 Copilot to transform work and workflow. 

In this case, it's a team of radiologists preparing for a tumor board meeting, helping them to create a draft agenda, take notes, write a teaching file, and then pull together a presentation. And we're seeing real world examples like this one across every sector.
name: Satya Nadella

description:
Agents in Microsoft 365 Copilot work with you and on your behalf, breaking down silos across your business applications.

And it's fantastic to see how our partners like Adobe, SAP, ServiceNow, and more are building agents to bring their unique knowledge right into the flow of your work and transform every business process and function, from HR and finance to sales.

The notion that you have go to siloed, bespoke business applications one at a time will be a thing of the past. 

You can see this in action below, and learn more here: https://lnkd.in/dF9hZ2RQ
name: Satya Nadella

description: 🚀 Phi-4 is here! A small language model that performs as well as (and often better than) large models on certain types of complex reasoning tasks such as math. Useful for us in @MSFTResearch, and available now for all researcher on the Azure AI Foundry! https://aka.ms/phi4blog
name: Satya Nadella

description: There's so much to love about Copilot, but Copilot Voice is a standout for me. Voice is more than a modality. It's quick, intuitive, natural, and even changes its tone depending on how you interact with it. It fundamentally changes how we connect with technology in this new age of AI. Try it for yourself: https://lnkd.in/gFdCwfwB
name: Satya Nadella

description: Proud of the depth and breadth of contributions from Microsoft researchers at this year's NeurIPS!
name: Satya Nadella

description: Imagine a world where every child has access to the vaccines and healthcare they need to survive. I go to work each day thinking about how the Gates Foundation can make that vision a reality.
name: Bill Gates

description: During times of crisis—like the devastating wildfires in LA right now—children face unimaginable disruption. But even when their schools close, they deserve to keep learning and maintain some sense of normalcy. I'm inspired by what Khan Academy is doing to make that happen.
name: Bill Gates

description: Effective public health is about more than just the ‘what’—it’s about the ‘how.’ Research by Nadia Akseer and her Exemplars in Global Health colleagues shows that a shared, data-backed approach can lead to lasting health improvements.
name: Bill Gates

description: Mike Maples was an extraordinary human, business leader, and friend. I’m lucky to have known him, and I’m thinking of his family during this difficult time.
name: Bill Gates

description: I thought I knew pretty much everything about Roger Federer’s tennis career, but I learned a ton—especially about his early years—from this retrospective. Filled with never-before-published photographs and personal insights from Roger himself, this book is a great gift for the tennis fan in your life: https://lnkd.in/gNc5sWYH
name: Bill Gates

description: The Carters were among my first and most inspiring role models in global health.
name: Bill Gates

description: Bono’s relentless pursuit of a healthier, more equitable world has transformed lives and communities. Congratulations, my friend.
name: Bill Gates

description: Malnutrition is the greatest health inequity in the world. Nearly two in every three children aren’t getting the nutrients to grow and thrive. But we have the innovations—and even more ideas in the pipeline—needed to make more progress and improve the lives of millions.
name: Bill Gates

description: It’s National Science Fiction Day—as good an excuse as any to recommend great books. Some of my favorite reads of the genre include Project Hail Mary by Andy Weir, Stranger in a Strange Land by Robert Heinlein, and The Ministry for the Future by Kim Stanley Robinson. From harrowing climate disasters to science teachers on spaceships, these books are sure to transport you to another world.
name: Bill Gates

description:
As 2024 comes to a close, I’m inspired by the progress the world has made, even on problems that once seemed unsolvable. And I’m grateful for a year of learning from brilliant people, experiencing small joys that keep me curious—like a good book or a great conversation—and, most of all, spending time with my family, including my newest granddaughter.
 
The challenges ahead are tough, but I’m optimistic that innovation and collaboration will lead to new breakthroughs—and make life better for more people—in 2025 and beyond.
name: Bill Gates

description: The world has lost a great champion in the fight against poverty and disease. President Carter never stopped working for a world where all children can grow up healthy and make the most of their dreams. He was an inspiration to me. I will miss him dearly: https://lnkd.in/gfqwdDHx
name: Bill Gates

description: Knowing where the planet’s carbon emissions come from is the first step toward eliminating them and eventually reaching net zero.​
name: Bill Gates

description: Recent advances in HIV prevention, especially the breakthroughs in long-acting PrEP, offer powerful new ways to protect people. The next step is to make sure everyone has access to these life-saving interventions. ​
name: Bill Gates

description: Child mortality rates are still far too high, but the world is moving in the right direction. By better understanding root causes and staying committed to prevention and evidence-based interventions, we can speed up progress and save even more lives.
name: Bill Gates

description: The European Platform for Neurodegenerative Diseases (EPND) has just launched their data hub—a game-changing resource that will accelerate research through collaboration and innovation in the field.
name: Bill Gates

description: Here’s the kind of book I love—one that sparks curiosity and helps you see the world differently. Grady Hillhouse, P.E.’s Engineering in Plain Sight reveals the mysteries of modern-day infrastructure in a fascinating and approachable way: https://lnkd.in/gTTQq84S
name: Bill Gates

description: I’ve said it before: Texas is at the forefront of the clean energy transition. Not only are these groundbreaking companies driving innovation—they’re bringing good jobs to their communities and boosting the American economy: https://lnkd.in/gJKtzg7V
name: Bill Gates

description: The future of fusion is brighter than ever. By harnessing the same process seen inside a star, Commonwealth Fusion Systems’ power plants could one day produce extraordinary amounts of clean energy to meet the world’s growing demand.
name: Bill Gates

description: The 2024 #WorldMalariaReport shows that the fight against malaria is getting harder as climate change raises temperatures and expands mosquito habitats. By 2050, over 1.3 billion people in Africa—around 75% of the population—will live in areas where malaria will be more difficult to eradicate than it is today. The good news is that, with transformative tools and increased commitment, we can fight back against malaria and the challenges it brings.
name: Bill Gates

description: Reading Jonathan Haidt’s The Anxious Generation made me reconsider the “Think Weeks” I did starting in the ‘90s. If I had grown up with today’s tech and all the distractions that come with it, would I have been able to get as much done? What I like about Haidt’s new book is that it brings up some difficult questions about young people living life online—but it also provides a roadmap for how we can help them change course: https://lnkd.in/gf_-7HRx
name: Bill Gates

description: Figma co-founder and CEO Dylan Field shares his vision for the future of AI, design and human creativity. He’s increasingly optimistic that innovation will “lower the floor and raise the ceiling” for what people can accomplish. An excellent South by interview with The Verge’s Nilay Patel.
name: Jeff Weiner

description: Brilliant. Kudos to the folks at Heineken for putting this together. Reminds me of the excellent work StoryCorps is now doing with their One Small Step  program that helps set up 1:1 interviews between people with differing perspectives. cc: Dave I.
name: Jeff Weiner

description: While the focus on AI interfaces of the future has typically been centered on the concept of Agents, arguably the most logical interface of all has been right in front of us all along: the browser. The Browser Company has been hard at work reimagaining what an AI capable browser can be, and just launched the first of many exciting innovations they will be releasing towards achieving their vision. Congrats to Josh Miller, Hursh Agrawal, and the incredibly talented team at The Browser Company on the launch of Arc Search and a new era of Smart Browsing.
name: Jeff Weiner

description: According to Him For Her founder and CEO Jocelyn Mangan, solving for thought diversity in the boardroom isn’t a pipeline problem, it’s a network problem. In this video, Jocelyn explains why solving this issue is so important and can be accomplished within the next ten years.
name: Jeff Weiner

description: Well articulated reminder from Adam Grant that compassion and empathy are not synonymous. Compassion = Empathy + Action.
name: Jeff Weiner

description: Don't typically comment on quantifiable milestones here as they're all part of the process, but 1B members is worth making an exception for. Congrats to every member of the team who worked so hard to make this possible. The best is yet to come.
name: Jeff Weiner

description: In 2015, had the great privilege of interviewing Matthieu Ricard. Was instantly brought back to the timeless wisdom and compassion he shared then in his most recent interview with the New York Times.
name: Jeff Weiner

description:
Was recently reminded of the surprisingly prescient vision of the digital future portrayed in this series of AT&T commercials released in 1994: https://lnkd.in/d6cV-n3U. 

As futuristic as the innovations seemed when the ads were first released, many would go on to become mainstream within the next two decades. 

Have seen a number of videos in the last few years focusing on the specific application of new technologies, e.g., AR/VR, autonomous vehicles, drones/flying taxis, robotics, etc., and we're all familiar with classic sci-fi films focused on an increasingly AI driven future. 

However, curious if anyone has seen anything produced recently comparable to the AT&T ads depicting what a future leveraging all of these technologies might look like 20-30 years from now?
name: Jeff Weiner

description: As editor of WIRED, Nicholas Thompson, was one of the clearest and most insightful thinkers I knew regarding the implications of newly introduced technologies. As CEO of The Atlantic, he's now in a position to help his team navigate and leverage those advances. Here's a recent note he shared with them on the rise of AI that can be more broadly applied to others in the process of developing their approach.
name: Jeff Weiner

description: Dave and the StoryCorps team have been building on this work to enable individuals to tell their stories and facilitate connections between people with different perspectives for years. Great to see this kind of well-deserved spotlight on such an important effort.
name: Jeff Weiner

description:
What a great article — well worth the time to read. Love the clarity Shaquille O'Neal applies to the brands and businesses he gets involved with, all derived from his sense of personal connection, value and fun. Clear demonstration of the power of authenticity as a leader, entrepreneur and an investor. 

Daniel Roth and Ryan Roslansky, how about an interview on “The Path”?!
name: Jeff Weiner

description:
Over an Internet career spanning nearly three decades, I've seen the introduction of digital applications that marked at least two key inflection points for the industry as well as society more broadly.

In 1993, Mosaic launched its browser, providing an interface that enabled everyday users to consume digitized content. The rise of the consumer web followed and nothing would be the same.

Between 2003 and 2005, Digg, Delicious, Flickr, and YouTube introduced applications that enabled everyday users to share digitized links, images, and videos. The rise of social media platforms followed and nothing would be the same.

With recent innovations in AI, it appears we're now on the cusp of a third inflection point.

In 2022, Open AI introduced DALL-E 2, enabling everyday users to harness the power of AI to generate images.

The rise of AI is certainly not a new theme. It's been the subject of science fiction for decades, and over the last few years, understanding its implications and investing in its application have ranked among the top priorities for many companies in Tech and beyond.

This intense scrutiny on AI is why I've been struck by how surprised some of the industry's top technologists, executives, and investors have been over recent advances in the state of the art and its growing accessibility -- GPT 1, 2, 3, Dall-E 2, and Stable Diffusion just to name a few.

What's even more stunning is the stuff that hasn't launched yet, but soon will. The rise of AI generated text, images, audio and video will follow and nothing will be the same.

If you thought the consumer web and social media were disruptive, you ain't seen nothing yet.
name: Jeff Weiner

description: Excellent interview with two of the most inspiring leaders I have the privilege of working with — Wemimo Abbey and Samir Goel. Here’s a brief excerpt in which they describe the talent they are looking for at Esusu:  “We’re doubling down on folks we call justice capitalists — people who have a head for business and a heart for the world. These people fundamentally believe that doing good and doing well are by no means mutually exclusive.”
name: Jeff Weiner

description: Congratulations Esusu and Fannie Mae, on this industry transforming collaboration to create a more equitable housing market. Esusu continues to exemplify that doing well and doing good are not mutually exclusive. Well done, Wemimo Abbey  Samir Goel  and the Esusu team!
name: Jeff Weiner

description: A stunning example of compassionate capitalism. Patagonia has always been a leader of this movement, but this takes it to another level. Hopefully, just the beginning and a model to be followed in the future.
name: Jeff Weiner

description:
Congrats, Dylan! It's nothing short of extraordinary to see what you and the team have accomplished over the last ten years. 

From the moment you started as a LinkedIn intern and conceived of the idea for LinkedIn for Good, it was clear you were an unusual talent (shout out to Tim O'Reilly and DJ Patil for recognizing your ability so early on). As much as we were hoping you'd join the company post-graduation, we all knew you were destined to be a game-changing entrepreneur. 

Unsurprisingly, over the last decade of working together, you have set the bar in terms of defining the kind of visionary founder, world-class executive, and industry transforming start-up I aspire to support as an investor and coach. Thank you, Dylan. Couldn't be more excited to watch where you take the company and what you accomplish from here!
name: Jeff Weiner

description: One of the most eloquent and insightful metaphors for teamwork I’ve heard, from jazz great Wynton Marsalis.
name: Jeff Weiner

description: Nice to see this important distinction gaining more traction: Empathy is not an end game but rather a means towards a more compassionate outcome. Put another way: Compassion = Empathy + Action
name: Jeff Weiner

description: Great opportunity to hear Sean Mendy, founding partner of Concrete Rose Capital, discuss his vision for how Concrete Rose helps to fund underserved founders and start-ups. I've had the privilege of working with Sean and his team over the last couple of years and couldn't be more impressed by their progress to date. h/t Alan Waxman
name: Jeff Weiner
